Cell.Data: Be sure to revisit ports and buildings now and again - you never know when a new opportunity may present itself...
As you know, <player>, prices at markets and shops fluctuate based on local supply and demand, season, tastes and special conditions.
If you choose to haggle, make sure that what you are saying is appropriate to the situation at hand.
The market is finicky, <player>. Make sure you keep your offerings fresh, or you'll see your profits take a dive.
Be careful around here, <player>. Not everyone you come across is to be trusted.
There sure seems to be plenty of opportunity for entrepreneurs these days.
The more chocolate I eat, the more I seem to crave it.
There is nothing like a good, strong cup of coffee to get the day started off on the right foot.
You'd be wise to make sure that you're continually introducing new confections into the market. Consumers love new things, and are willing to pay for them.
I've been hearing really good things about your confections, <player>.
I am sure excited about coffee, <player>. I hope you are too!
Ahh, Japan is just beautiful this time of year!
So you're the one they've got making decisions over at Baumeister Confections, eh?
There are forces at play, <player>, beyond your understanding, and beyond your ability to control.
When things are going well, they go well. But when they go bad, they can go really bad.
Click on an ingredient to buy some:
So, you are the one making waves in the chocolate world. Alex sent word you might come. I am %bal_marketkeep%. Welcome to our island!
Welcome, welcome! Come in out of the sun. It is a hot one today, eh?
Ah, the traveler returns. You are looking for spices? Fruit? I have the best on the island right here.
Smile, <player>! You are in %bali%. We do business here, but we do not rush.
Welcome to Agung Shadows, <player>. Make yourself comfortable. Business is better when we are both smiling, yes?
Selamat siang! Come, smell all of these beautiful spices.
I saw you coming from the dock. Your ship rides low in the water. You must have a lot of money to spend, eh?
My stall felt too quiet without you, my friend. Tell me, what do you need?
Happy New Year! A new calendar, a new cycle. Let us start it with a good transaction, yes?
Love is in the air! Or maybe that is just the cloves. Otherwise, I can help.
Shh. Soon is Nyepi. The whole island will be silent to fool the spirits into thinking no one is home. But today... we make noise. We trade!
I hear you celebrate the big holiday soon. The day of gifts. I have gifts here... nutmeg, cinnamon... better than socks, I think.
<player>, it is good to see your face again. Did your travels treat you well?
Ah, hey! The market is loud, but for you I always have a minute.
Welcome back to the %dou_market%, <player>. Come, have a look.
The sun is strong today, eh? Come stand in the shade of my stall.
Good, a friendly face. I've been dealing with hagglers all morning. What can I help you find?
Hello, my chocolatier friend. Tell me what you need, and don't waste your wings flying around the world for worse prices than mine, eh?
Back so soon, <player>? Your factories must be running fast! I like that kind of efficiency.
You sure must love my ingredients, don't you, <player>?
You're making those %i04% for Mrs. Siqueira over at the hotel here in town, <player>, right? I have the %pepper% and the %anise% you need right here.
Word travels fast in this market! You must be here for my %vanilla% to use in that new recipe you got from Japan, eh?
Good to see you! Ilan at the port in Morocco sent word you might be coming. He said you have a special recipe that needs some sweet Mangoes.
Aloha, <player>. Let me know if you need anything.
Welcome. The good stuff's right here. Sun's hot today, yeah?
Long trip? You look like you could use a break. Anyway, you know where everything is.
Hey, you're back. Need to restock?
Hey there. See anything you like, just give me a shout.
You looking for ingredients? You're in the right place.
Oh! Hello. I didn't see you come in. Can I help you find something?
Welcome back to %toronto%. It's... it's really nice to see a familiar face.
Is there something specific you needed? I can check the back room if the shelves are empty.
Please respect my produce, and I will respect you. What do you need?
You must be here for the %lime%.
The air is dry today. The %lime% are sharp.
Our Country provides. What will you take?
Don't stand around. If you're buying, buy.
You're back. Good. The new harvest is in.
Welcome, <player>. Come in, come in. What do you need today to keep the Baumeister machines running?
It is good to see your face again. My shelves are stocked and ready for you.
Guten Tag, <player>. How can I assist you?
Ah, <player>. Good to see a friendly face. How can I help?
Good day, <player>. What do you need today?
A pleasure doing business with a reasonable person. Thank you for your purchase.
See? I'm glad we could work out a deal that benefits us both.
I'm happy that we could come to an agreement. Enjoy the ingredients!
Thanks. But next time, you'll recognize a fair price when you see one.
Fine. Thank you for your purchase, I suppose.
Terima kasih! May your journey be smooth.
Good, good! I will be here when you need more, <player>.
The spirits are smiling on this transaction. Be well.
Ah, nice choice. Those are very fresh.
A sound trade. Go now, create something delightful.
A good trade makes the food taste better, don't you think?
Treat these ingredients with respect, and they will make you rich, <player>.
Good. Now I have money, and you have the best goods in the Indies. We are both winners.
You want more cacao? Good. Santoso up at the plantation thinks he is the only one with beans, but mine are just as good.
The cloves are strong this year. They will numb your tongue if you are not careful!
The tree of life! We use the wood, the leaves, the oil... nothing is wasted here.
Ah, the seed of the Myristica! A king's spice. You have chosen well.
Use those quickly! They are sweet like honey, but they are messy. Do not ruin your nice suit.
The mangoes are in prime seasonality today. Later? Maybe too soft. But today... perfection.
Juice running down the chin... that is the only way to eat a mango in season.
Good for the body, is it not? But wash your hands after you touch it, or you will have yellow fingers for a week!
These will treat you well. I don't bother stocking anything less.
All done. Take care on your way through %douala%, you hear?
You know where to find me when you need more.
Thank you. Watch yourself in the crowd on the way out, it gets busy.
Thanks for bringing your business here, <player>. My family and suppliers really appreciate it.
There we are, <player>. Anything else while you're here?
Ah, the anise! Its sweet spice will be perfect for Mrs. Siqueira's recipe. I hope she knows how much work goes into what you make for her.
Those peppers have a good, steady heat. Don't be shy with them - that recipe needs a little fire to wake it up.
That's proper cinnamon, not the dry bark some people sell tourists. It'll sit nicely beside your %vanilla%.
There you go. That %vanilla% travelled far to reach %douala%, but one breath of the aroma tells you it was worth it, eh?
Here you are. These Mangoes are for Ilan's recipe then? Tell him Tomge's still keeping him honest - and that he still owes me for that last spice shipment.
See? We talk like people, and we both walk away smiling. I like doing business with you, <player>.
You understand value, not just numbers. Thank you, my friend.
Remember: a bit of kindness costs nothing. Next time, try talking with me, not at me.
We're done for today. Just keep in mind this stall stands on respect, not shouting. Okay?
Next time, let's speak to each other like friends again, eh?
Right on. This should serve you well.
Good choice. This stuff's the real deal.
Alright then. Let me know how that batch turns out.
You need anything else, <player>, you just let me know.
You can't leave Hawaii without mac nuts. It's like... against the law or something. Enjoy 'em.
Thanks! I'll make sure these get loaded onto your transport carefully.
Have a safe trip! Come back soon.
Okay, all done. Do you need a receipt for your records?
Thanks, <player>. It was nice talking to you.
Nice choice. It really is the icon of Canadian food.
It's the real Grade A syrup from Qu√©bec. My grandmother says the darker syrup has more flavor to it.
I just wiped down all the maple syrup jugs, so they shouldn't be sticky. If that helps?
There should be some paperwork to sign for buying alcohol around here. Just put your name and signature down when you're ready.
That's... quite a strong rye. Please be careful with the bottle on your way out.
These sugar sacks weigh a fair bit. I... I can't lift them myself, but I can point out which pallet is the freshest.
Please be quick with the %milk%! The refrigeration unit is acting up again and I'm terrified it's going to spoil on my shift.
The classic milk-run, I see? Make sure to get these to your factory's cold room quickly.
This cream came from the dairy farms in Guelph this morning. Should work perfectly for all the good stuff you'll be creating in your factories.
The cream is very rich today. I checked the dates myself this morning, so I know it's good.
These pecans are expensive imports, so I have to weigh them out firmly. No snacking, sorry... store policy.
Be careful with the raspberry sacks. They bruise so easily, and the boss doesn't appreciate it when the juice stains the floor.
Low-bush blueberries, these ones. I spent all morning sorting out the stems, so they should be ready for your factory immediately.
These just came in from the north. My fingers are still a little blue from sorting them! Use them in good health.
I kept this butter in the back of the cooler where it's coldest. It should hold up for your trip.
The toffee bits are pre-crushed. It saves a lot of time. I used to have to smash them with a hammer in the back room - it was loud.
Don't chip a tooth on that toffee! It's very hard.
Ontario Northern Spies. Best apples in the world, honestly.
I picked out the shiny ones for you. They smell wonderful, don't they? Like crisp autumn air.
Your hands might get purple if you touch these. Here, let me wrap the sacks in paper for you.
This is local clover honey. It crystallizes if it gets too cold, so keep it at room temperature.
These beans smell amazing, don't they? I'm not allowed to drink the inventory, but sometimes I just stand here and smell the burlap sacks.
Wow, these beans smell strong. The whole shop is going to smell like coffee for the rest of the afternoon.
Cashews are really popular lately. I've had to restock this bin three times today already. My arms are tired, haha!
Mr. Tangye - sorry, "Joseph" - usually asks for these specifically for the Blends factory. I hope you aren't taking his stash!
These are good walnuts. My grandmother used to put these in her loaves. I hope you make something just as nice with them.
Okay, it's done. I'll just... put this receipt at the bottom of the pile so he doesn't see it right away.
Thank you. Please, just... take the supplies quickly?
Phew. Okay. I hope you put those ingredients to good use.
Oh, thank you for understanding. You have no idea how much trouble I'd be in if I changed those numbers.
I really appreciate you paying the sticker price. It makes my inventory count so much easier at the end of the day.
Thank you. I know it's expensive, but the quality is really good. I packed the bags myself.
Don't waste them. They're good this season.
That's all. Watch yourself on the roads.
I trust you're making something worthwhile with these.
Done. Now, get out of my sight.
Thank you for your business. May these bring you good fortune.
Anything else I can help you with, young one?
May these ingredients serve you well. Go on now, make something wonderful.
Here's what I am willing to pay for your items:
Welcome back to your shop! Here's the premium pricing I can offer:
Welcome to the best shop on Adderley Street! What can I tempt my regulars with today?
Mholo, <player>! What have you got for us today?
Velkominn, <player>! So glad you stopped by.
You've come to the right place. Let me know what you're selling today.
Hey there! Let's see what you've got for me.
Come on in, <player>. Please make yourself warm. Anything I can help you with?
Ah, you're back! The shop was starting to feel a little empty without your creations.

You're the new operator from Baumeister, then? Heard Whitney was putting her faith in you. She's either a genius with those %exotic% or completely mad. Probably both. Well, anyway, I'm Karolyne. I sell the quirky stuff in here, so let's see what you got.
Right, you're back. Don't waste my time with the boring stuff unless you have to. Show me something new!
Thank goodness, a delivery! I was about to die of boredom. What have you brought me? Anything interesting?
Finally! Someone who doesn't just want to talk about the weather. Let's do business.
Hey, <player>! My shelves are a bit bare. What have you got for %wel_shop%?
Okay, hit me. What new, brilliant, possibly unsellable thing have you and Whitney cooked up this time? I'm ready.
Welcome to %wel_shop%. Official greeting over. Now then, are you selling anything today?
Your goods appear to be top notch! How can I help you?
Welcome, <player>. Let's do some business, shall we?
Hi there! How is my favorite chocolatier today?
Welcome to %zur_shop%. Here's the prices I can offer you today.
Thanks for doing business with us!
I'm glad we could come to a better arrangement. It's a pleasure doing business with you!
Excellent. This is how business should be done.
It's good that we could work out a deal. These will sell nicely!
A pleasure, as always. It's good to work with someone so savvy.
Hm. I thought you were going to walk away. Well, pleasure doing business with you.
So you decided to sell after all. Thank you for the goods.
I'll take them. But I'm not happy about how our negotiation went.
Yes, yes, the deal is done. A pleasure, I'm sure.
Nice! These will be gone by the weekend. Thanks for stopping by!
Got anything else to share with us today, <player>?
Always a pleasure doing business with you. Safe travels out there!
Thanks for the great products, <player>. Anything else?
Perfect! My customers are going to love this.
Great! This will fly off the shelves. Let me know if there's anything else I can do for you today.
Excellent transaction. Fast, efficient, and now I have something interesting to sell. Wish all my suppliers were like you.
Done. Now I just have to figure out how to describe this to someone. That's the fun part.
My shelves look more interesting already. Thanks, <player>.
Right, that's sorted. My customers will be happy. Or at least intrigued. Same thing.
Perfect! This will definitely get people talking.
The first batch of %1% in the entire world, right here in my shop? Oh, this is going to be fun. The other shopkeepers are going to be so jealous.
Hold on. No one else has sold this yet? You brought your brand new %1% to me first? Ha! I knew you were smart.
Wait, you're giving us your first ever %1%? YES! This is what I live for!
Oh, %b01%. The essentials. Fine, I'll buy them, but this isn't what gets my blood pumping, you know?
Right, the %b01%. They'll sell, they always do. It pays the bills. Thanks, I guess.
Oh, %b02%. The essentials. Fine, I'll buy them, but this isn't what gets my blood pumping, you know?
Right, the %b02%. They'll sell, they always do. It pays the bills. Thanks, I guess.
Yeah, I'm glad I'm giving top dollar to goods like yours I love to bits.
I'll take them. But that was a painful conversation. Just... take the money.
Right. The deal is done. Let's not do that again, agreed?
Look, I'll take them because I need the stock, but don't try that nonsense again. My first offer was fair.
Much appreciated! What else can I do for you?
We appreciate the business, <player>. Thank you!
I'm always looking for products to stock my shelves. Come back when you have something to sell!
Oh, just browsing today? No problem at all. Feel free to warm up in here for a bit. The shelves will be waiting for you when you have something to sell.
Nothing on hand? That's alright, the life of a chocolatier is a busy one. I'll be here when you're ready to restock.
I was hoping to see what new creations you've been working on. Well, next time perhaps!
Oh, just stopping by to say hi? That's cool too! Let me know when you've got a new batch ready.
Traveling light today, huh? No worries. Just don't be a stranger for too long, okay? The customers miss your stuff.

You came all the way here just to look? Huh. Not the start I was expecting. Well, my name is Karolyne, and this is my cool and quirky shop, %wel_shop%. Just... come back when you've got something to put in it.
Nothing? You came all this way with nothing new for me? What a waste of a trip.
You're empty-handed? Seriously? My shop thrives on novelty, <player>. It can't thrive on chit-chat. Go make something.
Don't just stand there looking apologetic, it's inefficient. Go to your factory and be brilliant. Then come back.
Empty inventory. Right. Well, the shelves look the same as they did five minutes ago. See you when you've actually got something for me.
Oh, so you don't have anything on hand. Make sure to come back and see me once you got something to sell to us!
Nothing today, ja? At least I'm glad to see you, <player>. I hope to see some products from you soon!
How can I be of service today?
You can see I carry only the finest ingredients. What can I do for you?
Welcome! What are you looking for today?
It is always my pleasure to serve you.
Have a look around, take your time...
You don't find ingredients of this quality just anywhere.
You look like someone who knows quality ingredients when you see them...
Nothing but the freshest ingredients will you find here, my friend.
I assure you, my goods are of the absolute finest caliber.
Did you have something to chat about?
Prices are just numbers written in chalk. We can change them, if the conversation is good.
I am always happy to talk. Convince me.
You are so serious! Relax your shoulders. Now, tell me what you are willing to pay.
You don't like the numbers on the price tags? Tell me why.
I have ears. Speak your mind, but speak it softly, eh?
Let's do it to it. What's the conversation?
You want to talk numbers? Let's talk numbers.
Everything's negotiable, I guess. To a point. What are you thinking?
This should be interesting. Go on.
I... I'm really supposed to stick to the prices on the tags.
Is something wrong with the total? I double-checked the math...
I don't think I'm allowed to change the prices myself without asking my manager.
Did you want to discuss the rates? I can check the ledger again, but I promise these are standard.
You're... you're asking for a discount?
Please don't make this difficult. I'm just an employee here.
The price is the price. What are you doing?
This is not that kind of place.
You have a problem with my price?
You think you know a better price for this Country's fruit?
Is there something on your mind, <player>?
Alright. You have my attention. Speak plainly.
My prices are fair, but my ears are always open. What's on your mind?
I wish there was some way I could help you out here.
My ingredients are of the absolute highest quality - and for this one must pay.
What you see is the best I can do, my friend.
My prices are already the best in this area.
Maybe some other time - but not today.
Enough is enough. Now pay or be gone.
Perhaps you do not understand... I can charge whatever I feel is appropriate.
You have tried my patience. My prices are now going up.
Maybe next time you'll recognize a good deal when you see one.
My prices were already fair in the first place. You lost your chance to be reasonable, my friend.
I grow tired of your company. Either make a purchase or be off!
Do not bark at me! I am not a dog in the street!
Too loud, too aggressive. You have ruined my day, <player>.
I was smiling when you walked in. Now I am frowning. This is expensive for you.
Tch. You shout too loud with such disrespect. I think we are done negotiating.
Bah. You sound like the Dutch traders from the old days.
Greed is a heavy stone to carry, my friend. I suggest you drop it, because I am done helping you.
We were having such a nice time, and then you had to go and spoil it with greed.
And just like that, my generosity has decided to take a nap.
You are like a monkey who grabs too many bananas and drops them all. I am done being nice.
Whoa. We don't talk like that here, <player>.
You think this is some mainland tourist trap where you can bully the locals? Not my stall. Im adding a 'haole tax' just for you, so look at these new prices.
Listen. You're disrespecting me, and you're disrespecting the people who grow this food. I don't think I want to sell to you today.
That's not how we do business. You just talked yourself into a worse deal. Congratulations.
It's nothing personal, I'm just, like... tired and cranky today. Forgive me.
Wow. You know, for that, I think the price just went up. I'm kinda annoyed now.
I'm sorry, I have to get back to work now. I can't help you with this.
I... I think you should just pay what's on the tag. Please.
Don't try to trick me! I know the inventory is worth more than that.
This feels wrong. I can't authorize a discount like that. I'm sorry.
I'm getting really nervous. I think I should just charge the standard retail rate. I don't want any trouble.
No, I could get in serious trouble. Just... forget I said anything.
I'm getting a headache. Please, just take it at the sticker price or leave. I can't argue anymore.
No... no, that's not right. The manifest says this is premium stock. You have to pay the full tariff.
I tried to be nice, but you're asking for too much. ...Um, please excuse me. I have to go check on something in the storage units.
Please stop pressuring me into more discounts! I'm closing this register now.
You're going to make me put on an embarrassing display towards everybody in the room. Please don't ruin my day like that.
You're being unreasonable. I'm closing this register. If you want this, it's full price. No more talking.
I... I think I hear the boss coming. I can't give you a discount! I'm sorry!
You come onto our Country and insult my work? See if you find these %lime% anywhere else.
Get out. I'm not selling to you today. Or tomorrow.
This is exactly why I'm careful about who I deal with. You've shown me who you are. The deal is off.
My price is outrageous? You want to see outrageous? Pay it or leave.
You sound like all the others. And for that, you get the same answer. A higher price.
I make a gesture, and you take it as weakness. I was wrong about you.
So that's how it is. You mistake respect for an opportunity.
I thought foreigners act like that all the time. Don't do that again.
That is not a tone for business, or for friendship.
We have all seen enough ugliness in the world, yes? Let's not add to it here over a few francs.
No. That is my final word on the matter. Please, do not ask again.
I am disappointed. I run an honest market. Perhaps you should take your business to someone who does not.
I thought Alex had chosen someone with more grace. On second thought, I find my prices have just gone up.
I have no time for such games. Either you buy, or you let the next person in line have their turn.
Don't be greedy. I was generous once, but you've asked for too much.
Why can you not be happy with the already fair and low prices I originally made just for you? You went too far.
I was already offering you the best prices you could've asked for!
Now hold on a minute. I gave you a fair price, and you're trying to squeeze me dry. The offer's off the table.
I thought we were having a reasonable discussion, but now you're just being insulting.
You had a good deal in your hand and you threw it away.
Wow. The nerve. Forget it, my generosity has run out.
And that's where you cross the line from 'savvy negotiator' to 'pain in the neck'. Take this price, or leave it.
I suppose I can do something for you - this time.
You're very lucky. You caught me in a good mood. How do these prices look?
I can give you a deal - just don't tell anyone else, or I'll be out of business.
I can give you a special deal today, since you're such a loyal customer.
I hope you know you're killing me here, but I can give you a break.
You drive a hard bargain. How do these prices look?
I can see my way to offering you a special deal this time.
Wow, you are one tough negotiator. I like that!
Fine. I'm not going to make a dime at these prices. I hope you're happy.
Since I'm in such a good mood today, I'll cut you a deal.
I suppose I could shave a bit off these prices. What do you think?
I don't normally do this, but I'm in a wonderful mood today. How do these prices look to you?
I can give you a break this time, but don't be expecting this kind of treatment every time you come by...
You drive a hard bargain, but I would like to keep you as a regular customer. Let me see what I can do.
For you, my friend, I can make a very special offer.
Hah! You have a silver tongue. I should hire you to sell for me!
That is a smooth rhythm. You respect me, I respect you. Done.
You remind me of my grandfather. He also knew exactly what to say to get what he wanted.
For a friend of our island? I can make the numbers disappear a little bit. Just for you.
You speak with wisdom. It is hard to say no to that face.
I like you, <player>. You understand how this works. I will make the adjustment.
You are pushing the boat out very far... but the water is calm today. I will do it. One last time.
Aiyee, you are squeezing the life out of this old man! Fine! Take it!
Hah. Alright, you've got a point. I can knock a little off for you. But just for you.
You drive a fair bargain. I respect that. Let's see... yeah, I can make that work for you.
Fine, fine. You're killing my margins, you know that? But I'd rather sell to you than some of these other characters.
Don't want the other vendors to hear me doing this... but for a regular, I can adjust the price. This stays between us.
You caught me on a good day. The surf was perfect this morning. Sure, I can help you out a bit.
Hmm. You make a good point. Okay, I can be flexible. Take a look at these numbers...
You know, Leialoha next door would have my hide if she knew I was giving you a discount. Just for today, here's something for you.
Okay... I think I can mark that down as a bulk discount. Please don't mention it to anyone?
Well... since you buy so much from us, I suppose it's alright.
Oh... okay. I think I can make that work without getting into trouble. Let's do it.
Oh! You noticed that sacks were slightly damaged? You're actually right. I can discount that. Good catch.
Phew. Okay. These numbers match the inventory sheet minimums. We have a deal.
You really help us move a lot of volume, <player>. I think the boss will secretly like this price.
Okay, shh. If we mark it as "wholesale," I think I can get away with that price. Just don't tell anyone.
The boss is at lunch. Okay. Yes. Let's do it quickly before he gets back.
Yes... yes, I can do that. It beats letting it spoil on the shelf.
Alright. Since you're helping Mr. Tangye, I can justify this price in the logbook. But only for you.
Okay! Okay, fine! Just... take the sacks and go before the manager comes back out. Hurry.
My hands are shaking... I really shouldn't do this. But... fine. I'll fix the ledger later. Just take it.
...Fine. The Country was generous this week. I can be too. This once.
My price is what the work is worth. But I have more than I need today. Take them.
You have been fair in your dealings before. Alright. A small adjustment. Don't expect it again.
If you will use my %lime% with care, I can do something today.
Fine. A little more. Now we are done talking.
You push hard like a fly. Take my %lime% at this price and go, before I change my mind.
You have a kind way of asking. In these times, a little kindness goes a long way. Let's see what I can do for you.
For someone trying to help the Baumeisters, I can make an exception. Alex needs every advantage she can get.
Hah. You drive a gentle bargain. It's refreshing.
Fine. I will adjust the numbers, but don't tell everyone or my cupboards will be bare again!
A fair point, well made. I can be flexible. Take a look at these prices now.
Alright, lean in. For you, a special price. But this stays between us, ja? Our little secret.
Always up to those irksome negotiator shenanigans, aren't you? But I can't deny the charm. This is for you, <player>.
Alright, alright! You've got me. I can do a little better still, but that's my final offer!
I admire your persistence! Okay, one more discount, for my most valued customer.
Ugh... my accountant is going to have my hide. Okay, look. A bit more. But if anyone asks, you paid full price, you hear me?
I should say no... but the truth is, I need to make room for the next shipment.
I... you know what? I admire the persistence. Let me see what I can do...
Okay, I can shave a little more off the top. But that's it.
You really don't quit, do you? Alright, fine. One last discount, but this is my absolute final offer.
Well, I have heard my prices are fair, you don't agree?
Everyone needs to make a little bit of profit.
You don't want me to go out of business, now do you?
I've often heard it said - you get what you pay for.
I wasn't born yesterday, you know. My prices are reasonable.
My prices are fair for these ingredients.
I'm not one to be easily swayed by bargaining.
I'm not here to lose money...
Hey, if you don't like the prices, you are welcome to take your business elsewhere.
I'm not working for nothing, my friend.
It is a good try! You almost had me. But no.
Shake your head all you want, but I cannot move on this. Not today.
You ask for the moon, but I only have coconuts. Let us be realistic.
Mmm. No. That note rings flat to my ear. Try again later.
I wish I could say yes to that face, but the answer is no. I must be serious sometimes.
